On 10/3/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>
>
> Ok. I may have sever=
al data sets (e.g. small one for smoke testing and
> a really huge one for =
complete regression testing) and I want to choose
> between them from the r=
unner. For instance:
>
> @Parameters(name=3D"smoke") public static Object[]=
 data() {
> return new int[][] {{0, 0}, {1, 1}};
> }
>
> @Parameters(name=
=3D"full") public static Object[] data() {
> // load data from external fil=
e or generate permutations
> return data;
> }
>
> Then you'll specify test =
type "smoke" or "full" on a runner and it
> will choose an appropriate set =
of the test data.


In my experience, it's pretty rare to see the same test=
 take either a very
short time or a very long time depending on the data yo=
u give it.

Typically, the "smoke" group and the "full" group will contain =
different
test methods (and the intersection, it not empty, will be made of=
 quick
tests).

Having said that, I obviously agree with you that supportin=
g parameters for
test methods is necessary to improve isolation (something =
that is done
poorly right now by JUnit3 and the parameterized test case pat=
tern since you
are exposing all the parameters to all the test methods, whe=
ther they need
it or not).


--
